CERTIFICATIONS: AWS Certified Solution Architect Associates Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK) CompTia Security Plus (SecPlus) Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)

SUMMARY: Seven years of Cyber Security, RFM, FedRAMP, five to six-year experience as an Information Security Officer and four years as an AWS Solutions Architect. Cyber Security: Certification and Accreditation (A&A), Project Management, Change Management, NIST 800-53 rev1 and rev4 and NIST SP 800-37 rev 1, 800-18, 800-53 rev 3 and 800-34, FIPS, FISMA, NIST family of security controls, POA&M, A&A Package, Knowledge of the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) PMBOK Project Management Knowledge Areas, Research Analysis, Risk management, Costs planning and, Project scheduling and Planning, General Management, Communication, Negotiation, Mediation Facilitation, Leaderships and Organization. AWS Solutions Architect: Cloud Orchestration / Automation: AWS CloudFormation, AWS Lambda, AWS Systems Manager, AWS SSM Parameter Store, Ansible, Docker, Jenkins, ECS, EKS, Terraform AWS Security: AWS Security Hub, AWS Guard Duty, AWS Shield, AWS Firewall Manager, AWS Inspector Monitoring and Event Management: AWS CloudWatch (Events and Logs), AWS SNS, AWS S3 Identity and Access Management: AWS Organization, AWS IAM, AWS AD Connector, Active Directory, AWS Workspaces, AWS Secrets Manager, etc Governance and Compliance: AWS Config Rules, AWS Organization, AWS Control Tower, AWS Trusted Advisor, AWS Well Architected Tool, AWS Budgets, AWS License Manager

TOOLS: AWS Platform: AWS CloudFormation, AWS Lambda, AWS Systems Manager, EC2, ELB, RDS, SNS, SQS, SES, Route53, CloudFront, Service Catalog, AWS Auto Scaling, Trusted Advisor, CloudWatch, VPC, AWS WAF, AWS SHIELD, AWS Guard Duty, VPC Flow logs, IAM, Security Groups, NACLs, Security Hub, EC2, S3, CloudWatch, CloudTrail. PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE: XLA FedRAMP Compliance /Clouds Security Architect VIENNA VA November 2016 to Present • Implement security best practices around Clouds Infrastructure using tools like; VPC, AWS WAF, AWS SHIELD, AWS Guard Duty, VPC Flow logs, IAM, Security Groups, NACLs, Security Hub. • Also used CloudWatch and CloudTrail for Monitoring and Logging respectively, thereby utilizing these tools to monitor event driven patterns and to integrated with Lambda Functions for Auto-remediations. • Using encryption and Certificates, for data security and Privacy using standard encryption mechanisms like KMS, for encryption at rest and encryption in transit. • Work with customers to define key capabilities and performance requirements. Develops technical roadmaps for future implementations. • Designed secure, cost-optimized, highly available, and fault-tolerant infrastructure in AWS.

• Architected and configured Dev / Stage / QA environments in AWS (VPC, subnets, security groups, EC2 instances, load balancer, RDS, Redis, route53, etc.). • Implemented security best practices in AWS including multi-factor authentication, access key rotation, role-based permissions, enforced strong password policy, configured security groups and NACLs, S3 bucket policies and ACLs, etc. • Optimized cost through reserved instances, selection and changing of EC2 instance types based on resource need, S3 storage classes and S3 lifecycle policies, leveraging Autoscaling, etc. • Leveraged EC2 CreateSnapshot API call to create snapshots of EBS Volumes on scheduled intervals. • Configured CloudWatch alarm rules for operational and performance metrics for AWS resources and applications. • Configured S3 events to set up automated communication between S3 and other AWS services. • Review Infrastructure as code and develop patterns, review patterns to support DevSecOps • Develops business case analysis on potential projects.Ensures security is integrated into all architecture solutions • Evaluates new application, infrastructure and cloud decisions in existing context of applications, infrastructure, standards, current business strategy and future business strategy. • Perform continues monitoring on the AWS, HUBZone, DataPipe, Salesforce and MS Azure cloud systems using Splunk, remediating all vulnerability and closing of all open POA&Ms. • Develop deliverables associated with a FedRAMP security authorization package (System Security Plan, Information System Contingency Plan, Security Assessment Plan, Security Assessment Report, Authorization to Operate (ATO), Risk Assessment Report (RAR), Business Impact Analysis, Privacy Impact Analysis, Contingency Plan, Contingency Plan Testing and Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&Ms). • Work closely with Engineer to deliver FedRAMP requirements and perform FedRAMP advisory engagements and 3PAO assessments and to ensure mitigation of System findings, updating POAMS. • Work with the client, SaaS providers and internal development team to identify security gaps and resolve them to protect client data. • Establishing, monitoring, and re-assessing systems Plan of Action and Milestones to effectively address systems weakness or vulnerabilities. • Advise developers and assist with the Lifecycle Assessment and Authorization (A&A) process and developing SSP. • Provide support for security related FedRAMP compliance controls; and audit systems, services, and processes to verify adherence to company security policies and procedures. • Develop information security policies, standards, procedures, and best practices to support a FedRAMP moderate operating environment. • Actively participate in the risk management program. • Perform security risk assessments, analyze results, and provide recommendations for mitigations/enhancements. • Consult with business groups and provide guidance on security-related topics and participate in team on-call rotation. • Preform detail Security Assessment on HUBZone, DataPipe, Salesforce and MS Azure AWS cloud systems by ensuring that costumer responsibility statement and FedRAMP packages are well implemented. • Evaluate, recommend, and implement security solutions and practices that protect online services and information assets and help the company manage risks and meet compliance obligations. WASHINGTONTECH SOLUTION Inc. Information Security Analyst Upper Marlboro MD December 2014 to November 2016 • Implemented C&A duties and updated POA&M and Critical Control Review (CCR) analysis and remediation of POA&M and CCR findings. Involved in System Security Plan (SSP) Contingency Plans (CP) Contingency Plan Test (CPT), authorship, analysis and modification. • Provide ongoing gap analysis of current policies, practices, and procedures as they relate to established guidelines outlined by NIST, OMB, FISMA. • Updated and reviewed A&A Packages to include Core Docs, Policy & Procedures, Operations and Maintenance Artifacts, SSP, SAR, FIPS 200, FIPS 199, POA&M, BIA, PTA, PIA, and more Collected Operation and Maintenance artifacts on an ongoing basis so that Security Control Assessment (SCA) is seamless. • Provided security expertise and guidance in support of security assessments and supported A&A activities according to the A&A project plan. • Reviewed authorization documentation for completeness and accuracy for compliance and facilitated Security Control Assessment and Continuous Monitoring Activities. • Executed examine, interview, test procedures in accordance with NIST SP 800-53A Revision 4.

• Oversaw the preparation of a Comprehensive and Executive Certification & Accreditation (C&A) packages for submission to the Information Assurance Program Office for approval of an Authorization to Operate. • Reviewed and updating System Security Plan based on findings from Assessing controls using NIST SP 800-18 rev1, NIST SP 800-53a rev4 and NIST SP 800-53. • Applies appropriate information control for Federal Information Security based on NIST 800-37 rev1, SP 800-53 rev4, FIPS 199 and FIPS 200. • Conduct Security Assessment via document examination, interviews and manual assessments; Populate the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM) with results of Security Assessment. • Reviewed and update some of the system categorization using FIPS 199. Created and update Contingency plans and Disaster recovery plans for information systems using NIST SP 800 – 34. • Updated IT security policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines according to department and federal requirements.

SUMMARY___________________________________________________________________________ • 10+ years of experience in Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation and Production in Financial, Marketing and Healthcare Domains. • Developed applications using Ruby on Rails, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS, JQuery, Bootstrap, Java, JSP, J2EE, Spring, SQL, MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB, Python, Linux/Unix. • Have comprehensive knowledge in Ruby on Rails lifecycle: architecture, user stories, UX & UI. • Experience in developing Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), MVC based Applications using ROR and Java. • Worked with the teams that follow Agile Scrum methodology, participated in designing and planning the project. • Analyze, design, develop and implement various applications utilizing Ruby on Rails. • Experience in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Behavior-Driven Development (BDD). • Experienced various Open source and proprietary Ruby Gems with Heroku, Capistrano. • Used RSpec, factory girl/factory bot, cucumber, capybara and gherkin to create test/behavior driven development. Experience with all of the RVM, Bundler, GEMS and libraries for this version of the ruby/rails. • Practiced Test Driven Development with RSpec and Behavior Driven Development with Cucumber and Capybara. • Expert working knowledge on databases like RDBMS (MySQL, MS-SQL, SQLite, Oracle) & NoSQL (Mongo DB) • Proficient in designing and implementation of store procedures, views, triggers on databases such as MySQL, Hive, SQLite, PostgreSQL and Oracle. • Performed extensive programming in MYSQL to achieve all functionality. • High proficiency with front end web frameworks such as Angular.js. • Hands on experience with Non-SQL Databases such as CouchDB and MongoDB. • Worked with XML related technologies such as XML, XSD, XSLT and JAXB and used XML Schema for retrieving patient details in some of my projects. • Experienced in UI development using HTML5, CSS3, AJAX, JavaScript and jQuery, ANT and Maven. • Good Knowledge in developing single page application using Angular, React with responsive and reactive design(RXJS, NGRX, REDUX). • Experience with cloud services like Heroku, Amazon web services(AWS) EC2, S3 etc. • Have Knowledge in build and deployment tools like Jenkins • Developed and implemented various Ajax Frameworks such as jQuery, JSON. • Experienced in installing, configuring, modifying, testing and deploying applications with Apache. • Good Knowledge Objected Oriented Concepts, Standard Template Library, Smart Pointers, Data Structures and Design patterns.

• Hands on Ruby on Rails tools like scaffolding to construct the models and views, WEBrick and PUMA for Ruby web server management. • Expert in MS SQL Server BI components, Integration Services (SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS) and Reporting Services (SSRS) • Great experience with troubleshooting and debugging the code. • Excellent problem solving, analytical skills and critical thinking skills. • Experience in installation and configuration of multiple versions of Ruby using RVM (Ruby Version Manager) bundler install. TECHNICAL SKILLS____________________________________________________________________ Languages Ruby, SQL, MQL, HiveQL, Python, Java, PHP, C, C++ Database MongoDB, Oracle SQL, PostgreSQL, Hive Web and Scripting Languages Rake, Rails, JavaScript, JQuery, AngularJS, ReactJS, ASP, HTML5, CSS3. Ruby Testing Tools Rspec, Cucumber, selenium-webdriver, capybara, Minitest Application Servers Microsoft IIS, Tomcat, Apache (LAMP), Web sphere Operating Systems Mac OS, Linux (Ubuntu 8.04 through 11.10) & Windows (multi threading applications) Web Service Technologies SOUP, Restful UML Tools MS-Visio 2010/2013 Development Tools RubyMine, VS Studio, Sublime, Atom, VS Professional, Spring Tool Suite, Eclipse, Intellij Versioning Tools GitHub, TFS, TortoiseSVN Platforms Ubuntu, Windows server 2012, Windows 7/8/10, AWS (EC2, EMR) Network Protocols TCP/IP, UDP, HTTP

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE_____________________________________________________________ M9 Consulting Inc. Client: HBX, Washington, DC (July 2017 – Present) Senior Software Engineer / Ruby on Rails Developer Responsibilities: • Prepared and analyzed System Requirements Specifications (SRS) for a project and interacted with client during requirements specifications. • Implemented and enhanced CRUD operations for the applications using the MVC (Model View Controller) architecture framework. • Developed microservices to increase productivity, quality and security. • Created most important Business Rules which are useful for the scope of project and needs of customers. • Developed and tested many features for dashboard using Ruby on Rails, Bootstrap, CSS and JavaScript. • Planned and carried out daily scrums, weekly estimations and retrospectives and pair programming.

• Followed Test Driven Development (TDD), Scrum concepts of the Agile Methodology to produce high Quality Software. • Practiced Test-Driven Development with RSpec as well as Behavior Driven Development with Cucumber and Capybara to specify and test controller classes, models, view templates, helpers and routing. • User Interface for website with ERB, JQuery, html, css, Ajax in Ruby on Rails Framework. • Used Extreme Programming (XP) and Scrum practices. • Developed ETL workflows involving Data extraction, serialization, transformations and loading into mongodb. • Involved in creating and maintaining Database objects, Profiles and associated tablespaces, Roles and Privileges. • Used AMQP for messaging protocol. • Have exposer in building containers using Docker. • Used JQuery, Angularjs, Reactjs and Ajax in web applications to enhance the customer website experience. • Design and maintain ROR code. Implement upgrades, patches, code releases, and database changes using Mongo DB (NoSQL) • Peer-review code to satisfy quality, stability, performance, DRY patterns and security checklist. • Wrote ruby scripts for deployments onto AWS and Continuous Integration provisioning. • Analyzed software requirements and provide solutions and performed analysis, design, coding, testing, implementation, and maintenance of software solutions. Environment: Ruby 2.3 , Ruby 2.5, Rails 4.2, Rails 5.2 , HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Angular JS, ReactJS , JSON, OJ, Multi_JSON, Jquery, Rubygems, Unix/Linux, GIT/ GitHub, RSPEC, Minitest, Cucumber, Agile, AmazonEC2, MongoDB, Faraday, httparty, Actionmailer, Selenium-webdriver, Capybara, Devise, concurrent-ruby, Rubo 3T (ROBOMONGO), AMQP, Docker, Puma. M9 Consulting Inc. • ETL: Data extraction, managing, aggregations and loading into Hive. • Used Talend to perform ETL jobs. • Implemented Big Data tools within Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Oozie). • Created Hive External tables and loaded the data into tables and queried data using HQL that helped market analysts to look for emerging trends by comparing fresh data with EDW reference tables. • Used Hive to analyze the partitioned and bucketed data and compute various metrics for reporting. • Worked closely with other developers, project managers, UX designers, and marketers on agile user stories. Environment: Ruby, Rails, HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, JSON, Jquery, Rubygems, MySQL, Unix/Linux, Restful, GIT, WEBrick, RSPEC, Cucumber, Agile, AmazonEC2, Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Oozie. sections.text: CHRIS HUANG 41450 Culpepper Way. Leonardtown, MD 20650 858-397-3943; kuoweism@gmail.com https://www.linkedin.com/in/kuowei-huang/

QUALIFICATIONS SUMMARY Accomplished senior Model Based System Engineer with extensive experience in design and architect large-scale mission critical systems. Top Secret clearance access, skilled in supporting software, networks and aeronautics systems.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE NAVAIR 2020/10-Current Platform Integration & Modeling Lead Engineer • Support PMA-209 for Modular Open System Architecture (MOSA) realization at NAVAIR on MQ-25, FVL, E-XX, NGAD platforms. • Serve as the NAVAIR RE/SME in guiding program offices in building Model Based Open Architecture models; chair NAVAIR Digital Transformation Data Modeling COP TIM. • Research SysML v2 and API framework for model consistency, interoperability and re usability; draft Model Maturity Whitepaper with Georgia Tech over an awarded S&T fund. Northrop Grumman 2019/3-2020/10 Staff Engineer • Served as the NG Aeronautics Systems scrum master NGIDE team on MBSE digital engineering initiative in developing Methodology, Process, Templates, Reference Models, Profiles, Checklist, Style Guide, Model Maturity Metrics for internal programs usage. • Supported Global Hawks Modernization contract execution with AI image processing customization; GBSD on software modeling; NGAD MDAO design integration. • Experience with UAF DoDAF frameworks, SysML, UML, LML, OMS, DDS, Model Maturity and Metrics, system to software model transition; Cameo and Rhapsody tools. Naval Information Warfare Center – Pacific 2018/4-2019/2 Lead Engineer • MBSE support of: weapon systems (SSDS ICS & AEGIS), ships (DDG & CVN) and networks (NGEN & JWICS); research AOA, defined & synthesized requirements; planned and coordinated model development efforts. • Served as a member of the NMCI Cyber Security Tiger Team in assessing and reviewing security features and solutions on endpoints, networks, servers and services/processes, as well as identifying data for analysis. • Performed data analytics, model design and creation of SysML/DoDAF models; led internal development team on Cameo tool capabilities development; outlined Model as a

Service solution for network consolidation; supported NGEN Transformation modeling effort. Comcast Cable 2006/4-2018/2 Senior Staff Systems Engineer • Piloted MBSE system methodology in support of DRM cryptographic security system life cycle from definition to validation; o Created MBSE models in support of design analysis, with simulations to show how messages are coordinated, and keys are staying in sync. o Developed expert knowledge on PKI, federated identity and access management; patent submitted on Self Provisioning. • Performed MBSE modeling in SysML on MediaCipher Conditional Access system and DTA Encryption Infrastructure for video content protection over cable; o Demonstrated the security of the systems using model, resulted in certification to deliver high value content (new release theater graded movies) to settops. o Participated in Comcast Big Data Analytics as the access network lead in data manicuring, data analysis, supervised learning algorithm tuning. • Served as the subject matter expert in System Engineering over Agile development process by trial the processes to Key Server and embedded security client projects; o Developed SysML-based models that include use cases, activity, architectures, components, sequences, states, classes and requirements diagrams. o Led SW (Java) development of Linux based Key Server in cloud microservice (Kubernetes) with intelligent network health monitoring system. Cable AML 2002/6 – 2006/4 Software Engineer • Led software development of industry first microwave transceiver remote monitor unit with embedded SNMP and TCP/IP protocols in C for Boeing Video Surveillance System. • Performed network simulation (Opnet), link budget propagation and coverage analysis, create system design prototypes for network layer requirement and performance analysis. • Awarded patent: "Device and Method for Sharpening Image Signal" # 20070070428.

EDUCATION • Defense Acquisition University Engineering II Certification 2021/3 • University of California, Davis 2002/6 M.S. in Engineering & Applied Science – Communications Thesis: "Network Security in Fixed-Point Broadband Wireless Network" • University of California, Los Angeles 1999/6 B.S. in Cybernetics Requirements and Release Management: Contour, DOORS, Wiki, Bitbucket, Subversion, Gitlab, Jira, SharePoint; Modeling Tools: Cameo MagicDraw, IBM Rhapsody, Enterprise Architect; Data Tools: MS SQL, Tableau, Power BI; Cloud Automation: Ansible. Training Highlights: SDN, Link16, Air Worthiness, OMS, NLDP Leadership Development

Comcast Cable 2006/4-2018/2 Senior Staff Systems Engineer • Piloted MBSE system methodology in support of DRM cryptographic security system life cycle from definition to validation; o Created MBSE models in support of design analysis, with simulations to show how messages are coordinated, and keys are staying in sync. o Developed expert knowledge on PKI, federated identity and access management; patent submitted on Self Provisioning. • Performed MBSE modeling in SysML on MediaCipher Conditional Access system and DTA Encryption Infrastructure for video content protection over cable; o Demonstrated the security of the systems using model, resulted in certification to deliver high value content (new release theater graded movies) to settops. o Participated in Comcast Big Data Analytics as the access network lead in data manicuring, data analysis, supervised learning algorithm tuning. • Served as the subject matter expert in System Engineering over Agile development process by trial the processes to Key Server and embedded security client projects; o Developed SysML-based models that include use cases, activity, architectures, components, sequences, states, classes and requirements diagrams. o Led SW (Java) development of Linux based Key Server in cloud microservice (Kubernetes) with intelligent network health monitoring system. Cable AML 2002/6 – 2006/4 Software Engineer • Led software development of industry first microwave transceiver remote monitor unit with embedded SNMP and TCP/IP protocols in C for Boeing Video Surveillance System. • Performed network simulation (Opnet), link budget propagation and coverage analysis, create system design prototypes for network layer requirement and performance analysis. • Awarded patent: "Device and Method for Sharpening Image Signal" # 20070070428.
EDUCATION • Defense Acquisition University Engineering II Certification 2021/3 • University of California, Davis 2002/6 M.S. in Engineering & Applied Science – Communications Thesis: "Network Security in Fixed-Point Broadband Wireless Network" • University of California, Los Angeles 1999/6 B.S. in Cybernetics Requirements and Release Management: Contour, DOORS, Wiki, Bitbucket, Subversion, Gitlab, Jira, SharePoint; Modeling Tools: Cameo MagicDraw, IBM Rhapsody, Enterprise Architect; Data Tools: MS SQL, Tableau, Power BI; Cloud Automation: Ansible. data.objective: Seeking a full-time job in Control or Robotic fields.

sections.text: YI-CHUNG SU 321 South 5th Street, Unit 240, Ames, Iowa 50010 | yichusu@umich.edu | (734)709-5275
OBJECTIVE Seeking a full-time job in Control or Robotic fields.

EDUCATION University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, MI, USA Apr.2018 Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering GPA: 3.66/4.00 National Taiwan University, Taipei, Taiwan Jun.2014 Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering

WORK EXPERIENCES Smart Ag., Ames, Iowa(Autonomous Tractor Startup) Sep.2018-Present Autonomous Vehicle Engineer • Worked in the Agile Scrum team to improve the John Deere tractor's control system with python and Docker. • Redesigned the Tractor's safety system to deal with emergency conditions based on Test-driven Development. • Built the hardware simulator with fake CAN messages, fake perception messages and fake GPS data to test the system. • Programmed unit tests and integration tests for every function in the program using Travis, Catch2, and Fake-it. • Developed radar detection code using C++ and Bosch mid-range radar and Continental Radar. • Launched a heartbeat program between main CPU and redundant CPU by serial communication. • Implemented the Safety Stop program through I2C Bus between redundant CPU and brake module. • Developed the speed controller algorithm(Gear selection and throttle adjustment) for tractors with Power Shift Transmission by using state machine QNX environment. Automation Dept., Syntec Technology, Hsinchu, Taiwan(Leading CNC controller manufacturer) May-Jun.2017 Mechanical Engineering Intern • Built 3D CAD models including robotic arm, CNC, and conveyor system to demo industry 4.0 products. • Simulated milling processes using ABB Robotstudio Machining PowerPac to assess its auto-path generation function.

PROJECT EXPERIENCES Computer Vision Project April.2018 • Developed a feature-based lane detection algorithm using OpenCV. • Fine-tuned a CNN model to do car detection using YOLOv2 and achieved up to 87.6% IOU in the testing video. Vehicle Dynamics Project April.2018 • Simulated the linear vehicle model's movement by Simulink and Matlab. • Analyzed and identified the tire cornering stiffness by using the linear bicycle model and the experimental data. • Designed a steering controller to track a predefined path using Pure Pursuit control. Automated vehicles' Sensors and Data Mining Project Mar.2018 • Analyze Lidar/Radar/GPS/Ultrasonic data from rosbag. • Extracted lane change events from a naturalistic driving database using MySQL. Mechatronics Project Sep.-Dec.2017 • Sensor Fusion for Accurate Angular Measurement: integrated an accelerometer along with the low-pass filter and a gyro along with the high-pass filter for the pendulum tilt angle measurement. • Inverted Pendulum Mechatronic System Design: identified the model parameters and designed a full-state feedback control system to stabilize an inverted pendulum through Linear-Quadratic Regulator (LQR) method and a classical control system with two loops which the inner loop with negative feedback while the out loop with positive feedback. • DC Motor and Stepper Motor Position and Velocity Control: assessed motor's performance characteristics for different input and designed controllers to meet the position and velocity error requirement. Self-Driving Car Project Dec.2017 • Constructed a car obstacles-avoidance controller using PID control. • Achieved the controller with the planned-trajectory as the reference, traction force and steering angle as the control inputs to control the vehicle to follow the trajectory without crashing the track boundary. Robot Kinematics and Dynamics Project Apr.2017 • Developed a robotic arm that can grab a small-size object given its position using Arduino and servo motor. • Implemented DH table and two inverse kinematic methods (MIT rule and inverse Jacobian) to compute the joint angles and transmitted these data into Simulink and Arduino to activate the motor and simulation.
SKILLS C++, Python, Matlab, Simulink, Labview, Arduino, RobotStudio, SolidWorks, Linux, OpenCV, ROS, MySQL, YOLOV2, CUDA, cuDNN, CANBus, Docker, MQTT, Git, React, Redux, Travis CI, Catch, CMake, UDP
